result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher A Goodvine #310458 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Original to V/W
Order allowing withdraw of counsel.

08:34 AM Defendant Christopher A Goodvine in court, in custody with attorney Brian William Severson.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel made argument re: witness; Court granted State's motion to exclude that witness based on failure of time to disclose.   State objected to jury having pre-trial instruction #800 - self defense; argument; Court removed that instruction for pre-trial purposes; may be added at the end of testimony.  Discussion held about witnesses.  Defendant handed a note to Attorney Severson, would like to represent himself with standby counsel.   Court discussed this with defendant.  Court allowed brief recess to allow Attorney Severson to discuss this with defendant. Recess 8:55. Resumed 9:08. Defendant made a statement to Court. Asked the Court for new counsel. Stated reasons. State made statement. State held no position on the defense's request. No rebuttle by atty Severson. Court recessed 9:15. Resumed 9:22. Court made a statement to counsel and defendant. Court found good cause to adjourn the trial. Court granted request. Atty Severson is discharged from case. New final pretrial and trial dates to be set by JA. 9:30

Competency hearing on January 31, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher A Goodvine in court, in custody with attorney Brian William Severson.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Severson stated he received the report on Friday was able to discuss the report today with the defendant.  They are ready to proceed today.  Agree he is competent to proceed.  Court found the defendant competent to proceed.  Attorney Severson requested the court address concerns of his representation by defendant.  Court questioned defendant on the letter he submitted.  Defendant would like to keep attorney Severson.   Attorney Severson and defendant requested a second evaluation with a new evaluator.  State had no objection.  Court granted the request.  New evaluation for NGI plea to be conducted.  Defendant requested an inpatient evaluation.  Court denied that request.  9:54/10:03
